title: Tannie Poppie brings roosterbrood to Italy! – HERITAGE
text:
Poppie van As (63), who has been invited as a special guest to a three-day long cycling event in Gaiole, Italy, overshot her BackaBuddy fundraising goal and jetted off to Italy this past weekend.

Poppie, who hails from Laingsburg, sells roosterkoek for a living.

Her rendition of the authentic and iconic Saffa snack caught the attention and heart of international cyclist and resident from Woodstock, Stan Engelbrecht (43).

Stan then set up the BackaBuddy account to raise the money that is seeing Poppie and her roosterkoek off to Italy for the L’Eroica – which is an annual non-competitive cycling race that it due to start on Sunday, 6 October.

They shared this video as part of the plea on the BackaBuddy page, showing the ever bubbly Tannie Poppie sharing her story with us all:

Stan met Poppie in 2013 when he was cycling along the N1 close to Laingsburg.

He says at the time, Poppie was just an ambitious vendor selling roosterkoek to motorists.

“After I bought a roosterbrood from her by chance, I asked her to make it at a bicycle race I organised in the Karoo about six years ago. Everyone loved her boundless energy and positivity so much that I invited her back every year. So, our friendship grew,” says Stan.

He says Poppie has become very close to the cycling family, and himself, and he wanted to help her get a lifetime opportunity of not just boarding a flight or visiting a foreign country for the first time, but to document her story and make it an inspiration for others. Stan’s girlfriend, Donnet Dumas (32) will be filming the documentary throughout Poppie’s journey.

“Poppie has never left the Western Cape and this once-in-a-lifetime trip will change her life forever. It will alter her world-view. Perhaps this opportunity will inspire her peers and those around her small community to better their own lives too. It’s heart-breaking to travel through these Karoo towns and see people living with no hope, no prospects,” Stan says.

“Poppie’s life story is fascinating – filled with humour and often sadness. And with this opportunity to go to Italy it has become clear that her story is begging to be told.”

He says Poppie will receive half of all profits from the documentary and he will help her use the money wisely.

After rallying together the public, Poppie has begun her journey and will be sharing the wonder of the beloved SA snack with the land of the Tuscan sun.

This video was shared of her on BackaBuddy’s Facebook page of Poppie thanking everyone who has helped her raise the funds needed for this exciting opportunity:

Poppie is on her way to Italy! With over R102 000 raised and many hearts captured, Tannie Poppie is finally making her way to Italy where she will prepare her famous 'roosterkoek' to new adoring fans! 🇿🇦🇮🇹Well done, Tannie Poppie! Bon Voyage! ✈️https://www.backabuddy.co.za/poppie-van-as Posted by BackaBuddy on Wednesday, September 25, 2019

He says half of the funds raised is targeted to cover her visa application, travelling and getting her some basics for the trip.

The remainder of the money raised will go towards the documentary.

Poppie’s journey has already kicked off on a positive note as her seat on her first flight ever got bumped up to Business class.
